title: Client for the FIVB VIS Web Service \url{https://www.fivb.org/VisSDK/VisWebService/}

title: Client for the FIVB VIS Web Service \url{https://www.fivb.org/VisSDK/VisWebService/}

title: Client for the FIVB VIS Web Service \url{https://www.fivb.org/VisSDK/VisWebService/}
Client for the FIVB VIS Web Service \url{https://www.fivb.org/VisSDK/VisWebService/}
text: indicates XML response FIVB server large deeply nested causing parser fail. default parser restricts nesting level allows, order prevent crashes undesirable behaviour. can remove restriction : try request .

title: fivbvis — fivbvis

what: Get or set fivbvis caching behaviour — v_caching
title: Get or set fivbvis caching behaviour — v_caching
text: default, fivbvis starts session-specific caching (equivalent running v_caching(TRUE); v_cache_dir("session")).

title: Get or set fivbvis caching behaviour — v_caching
Get or set fivbvis caching behaviour — v_caching
text: caching logical string: TRUE, used cached results; FALSE, caching; "refresh", refresh cache cache_dir string: either "session" - use session-specific directory caching, meaning R closed restarted, cache cleared new one used "user" - use persistent, user-specific directory (returned user_data_dir string giving path specific directory use. directory must already exist

title: Get or set fivbvis caching behaviour — v_caching
text: caching setting (v_caching) cache directory (v_cache_dir) applying provided parameters

title: Get or set fivbvis caching behaviour — v_caching
code: v_caching(TRUE) ## turn caching on v_caching(FALSE) ## turn caching off v_caching("refresh") ## contents in cache will be updated  v_cache_dir() ## return current cache dir #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpJofzRR/filea84a25033b1e3" if (FALSE) {   v_cache_dir("session") ## use per-session cache   v_cache_dir("user") ## use persistent, user-specific cache   v_cache_dir("c:/my/cache/dir") ## use specific dir }

what: Return the fields for a given VIS data type — v_fields
title: Return the fields for a given VIS data type — v_fields

title: Return the fields for a given VIS data type — v_fields
Return the fields for a given VIS data type — v_fields
text: type string: data type, currently one "Volleyball Tournament", "Volleyball Tournament Filter", "Volleyball Tournament Ranking", "Volleyball Match", "Volleyball Match Filter", "Volleyball Pool", "Volleyball Pool Filter", "Volleyball Pool Ranking", "Volleyball Team", "Volleyball Team Filter", "Volleyball Player", "Volleyball Player Filter", "Volleyball Player Ranking", "Volleyball Statistics"

title: Request to get a beach volleyball Olympic Selection ranking — v_get_beach_olympic_selection_ranking
text: gender character: gender olympic ranking selection gamesyear integer: year return ranking selection. parameter specified, web service return ranking latest olympic games ranking. onlyselected logical: selection status returned teams. NULL specified, resulting list contain selected -selected teams. FALSE, resulting list contain non-selected teams. TRUE, resulting list contain selected teams referencedate Date: reference date ranking: ranking calculated. Olympic Games selection ranking calculated specified date, returned ranking empty. parameter specified, web service return ranking latest reference date fields character: fields return

Get a volleyball match — v_get_volley_match
text: integer: match number. Provide either (optionally fields) parent (optionally children). See Details fields character: fields return. relevant provided parent list: List named charactor vectors. Specify attributes Request Node. Ignored provided children list: Named list named charactor vectors. Add child nodes Filter, Relation. Ignored provided

title: Get a volleyball match — v_get_volley_match
Get a volleyball match — v_get_volley_match
text: Parameters can provided two ways. simple interface (retained backwards compatibility) accepts optionally fields. complex queries can issued using parent children parameters.

title: Get a volleyball match — v_get_volley_match
Get a volleyball match — v_get_volley_match
code: if (FALSE) {    ## using the simple interface   v_get_volley_match(13754)    ## or equivalently   pl <- list(No = 13754, Fields = paste0(v_fields("Volleyball Match"), collapse = " "))   v_get_volley_match(parent = pl) }

code: if (FALSE) {   pl <- list(Fields = paste(v_fields("Volleyball Statistic"), collapse = " "))   cl <- list(     Filter = c(NoTournaments = s_tournament$no, MatchesToUse = "MatchesFinished"),     Relation = c(Name = "Match",                  Fields = "NoInTournament DateLocal TeamACode TeamBCode MatchResult"),     Relation = c(Name = "Team", Fields = "Code Name"),     Relation = c(Name = "Player", Fields = "TeamName FirstName LastName VolleyPosition")   )   vb_statistics <- v_get_volley_statistic_list(parent = pl, children = cl) }
